noun.description: A large hairy spider found chiefly in tropical and subtropical America, some kinds of which are able to catch small lizards, frogs, and birds.
A large black wolf spider of southern Europe, whose bite was formerly believed to cause tarantism.

origin: Mid 16th century: from medieval Latin, from Old Italian tarantola tarantula, from the name of the seaport Taranto. Compare with tarantella and tarantism.
